sn47.19:4.1: At one time the Buddha was staying in the land of the Sumbhas, near the town of the Sumbhas called Sedaka.
sn47.19:4.2: There the Buddha addressed the mendicants:
sn47.19:4.3: “Once upon a time, mendicants, an acrobat set up his bamboo pole and said to his apprentice Medakathālikā:
sn47.19:4.4: ‘Come now, dear Medakathālikā, climb up the bamboo pole and stand on my shoulders.’
sn47.19:4.5: ‘Yes, teacher,’ she replied. She climbed up the bamboo pole and stood on her teacher’s shoulders.
sn47.19:4.6: Then the acrobat said to Medakathālikā:
sn47.19:4.7: ‘You look after me, dear Medakathālikā, and I’ll look after you.
sn47.19:4.8: That’s how, guarding and looking after each other, we’ll display our skill, collect our fee, and get down safely from the bamboo pole.’
sn47.19:4.9: When he said this, Medakathālikā said to her teacher:
sn47.19:4.10: ‘That’s not how it should be, teacher!
sn47.19:4.11: You should look after yourself, and I’ll look after myself.
sn47.19:4.12: That’s how, guarding and looking after ourselves, we’ll display our skill, collect our fee, and get down safely from the bamboo pole.’”
sn47.19:5.1: “That’s the correct procedure,” said the Buddha. “It’s just as Medakathālikā said to her teacher.
sn47.19:5.2: Thinking ‘I’ll look after myself,’ you should cultivate mindfulness meditation.
sn47.19:5.3: Thinking ‘I’ll look after others,’ you should cultivate mindfulness meditation.
sn47.19:5.4: Looking after yourself, you look after others; and looking after others, you look after yourself.
sn47.19:6.1: And how do you look after others by looking after yourself?
sn47.19:6.2: By development, cultivation, and practice of meditation.
sn47.19:6.4: And how do you look after yourself by looking after others?
sn47.19:6.5: By acceptance, harmlessness, love, and kindness.
sn47.19:6.7: Thinking ‘I’ll look after myself,’ you should cultivate mindfulness meditation.
sn47.19:6.8: Thinking ‘I’ll look after others,’ you should cultivate mindfulness meditation.
sn47.19:6.9: Looking after yourself, you look after others; and looking after others, you look after yourself.”
